item.title: Notifications
item.description: Push notifications are useful to inform about server restarts successful backups public IP changes updated docker images or any other results or errors in automatically executed scripts and events.

item.title: Home
item.description: echo "Hello world!" Welcome to my Notes! They are still a work-in-progress. The notes itself are written in Markdown with Obsidian. Then Quartz filters out the public ones and renders them into the static website you are seeing right now.

Kell on pool seitse - Iâ€™ts half past six Ãœks hetk - One moment Ma kohe vaatan - Iâ€™ll have a look Appi - Oh dear Pronouns Â§ ETENmina / maIsina / sayou (informal)teie / teyou (formal)tema / tahe/shemeie / meweteie / teyounemad / nadthey Requests Â§ Ãœtleme sina - Letâ€™s use informal you Tule palung siia - Please come here Helista siis mulle, palun - Please call me then Joo veel kohvi - Drink more coffee Palun Ã¤ra tee niimodi - Please donâ€™t do that Istu palun - Sit, please Kuhu ma istun? - Where can I sit? Thanks Â§ AitÃ¤h - Thanks TÃ¤nu - I thank you Suur aitÃ¤h - Big thanks Suur suur aitaÃ¤h - Thank you very much Palun - Please / You are welcome / Here you are Vabandust - Iâ€™m sorry Vabandage - Iâ€™m sorry (formal) Anna andeks - Forgive me Pole midagi/viga - No problem Pole hullu - Nothing crazy Getting acquainted Â§ ETENprouamrshÃ¤rramrkaptancaptainklounclownkas â€¦question with answer yes / notÃµestireallynatukenea little Saage palun tuttavaks - Get acquainted Saame tuttavaks - Letâ€™s get acquainted Meeldiv tutvuda - Nice to meet you VÃ¤ga meeldiv - Very pleasant Samad sÃµnad - Same here Me pole vist varem kohtunud - We probably have not met before Minu nimi on - My name is Kas ma tohin ennast tutvustada - May I introduce myself? item.title: 21 Lessons for the 21st Century
item.description: The long road ahead of us Â§ We are barely one-quarter into the 21st century and even though there is more than 3/4 to go, almost everyone is aware of at least some of the whole lot of issues that society faced recently and is facing just now.

item.title: Everybody Lies
item.description: A book for everybody Â§ Everybody lies can be read by everyone; this is the good message. The prominent buzzword Big Data can be found everywhere in recent years.

item.title: Clean Code
item.description: The title says it all Â§ What a book titled Clean Code deals with, is hardly any mystery, no matter your professional background. Its content can quite easily be summed up: the book teaches you, the coder and aspiring or practicing software developer, how you should write code.

item.title: Bullshit Jobs
item.description: A provocative claim Â§ The first line of this books Wikipedia-page quotes: â€œBullshit Jobs: A Theory (â€¦) postulates the existence of meaningless jobs and analyzes their societal harm.

item.title: Factfulness
item.description: Lets play a little game! Â§ Instead of giving a plain recommendation or review of this book, why donâ€™t you try to answer the following three questions without googleing; if you score less than two right answers, skip my review; you will definitely have to read this book! Where does the majority of the world population live? Low-income countries Middle-income countries High-income countries What is the life expectancy of the world today? 50 years 60 years 70 years How many people in the world have some access to electricity? 20% 50% 80% Our intuition is flawed Â§ I will just assume you have answered at least one of the questions wrong.
